definition: Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)
"a slave to certificates", sb who does one's utmost to obtain as many certificates as possible so to be more employable
double income family who have pets rather than children (see also 丁克[ding1 ke4])
"Pregnancy-oriented Economy", new market conditions brought about by a predicted baby boom in China
thin coat, meager food (idiom); life of wretched poverty/destitute
magnificent carriage and precious horses (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle/ostentatious display of luxury

pinyin: ai4 qing2 zheng1 fu2 yi1 qie4
Tu2 lei2 te4 shi4 zong1 he2 zheng4

definition: see 針尖對麥芒|针尖对麦芒[zhen1 jian1 dui4 mai4 mang2]
to accumulate gold and jewels (idiom); prosperous
see 只爭朝夕|只争朝夕[zhi3 zheng1 zhao1 xi1]
